content.description:
This is the right bolted line on the west face of the Whistle Pig.

A TR can be setup by climbing the northeast face.
content.protection: 4 bolts lead to a 2 bolt anchor.

content.description: Mongolian Boodog starts in the clean, left-facing dihedral on the right side of the slightly overhanging, south face of the Whistle Pig. Follow the jugs and natural weaknesses upward. This route is short and tasty; you will be going back for seconds.

Marmot Queen is good for kids or 1st timers. Top rope it.

Climb slab 10 feet left of

Gus

, just right of corner. One can access the top from Northeast Corner, 5.1.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor and a top rope. Note: there are no rappel links/chains.

content.description: Climb an overhang/bulge crux, then climb the center of the slab with one tricky move.
content.protection:
8 (10?) bolts plus a top anchor.

If you want to toprope, the best way is to traverse right from

Phil's

top anchors.
content.location:
This is just left of tree and about 15 feet right of

Phil

.

content.description:
This is the left bolted line on the west face of the Whistle Pig.  It is short and sweet; good for a beginner leader.

A TR can be setup by climbing the northeast face.
content.protection: 4 bolts lead to a 2 bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Dr. Julius Strangepork, Pigs in Space

content.description:
20 feet right of

Making Bacon

, look for overhang with crack above it. This can be climbed 2 ways to overhang, right or left of bolts. The left side is 5.11a, the right side is 5.10. Climb the 1st crux, and follow the short crack. Climb a steep slab for the 2nd crux to finish on easy slab.
content.protection: Draws and 2 gear placements 1/2" to 1 1/2"  for 5 foot crack. It is 5.8/9 R without gear.
